*Component items*:
  * *Mouth speaker* (*TARGET.TEA.SPEAKER*): move vocal cords together and serve production of voice
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): adduct and medially rotate the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments towards the midline and backwards and so closing off the rima glottidis
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): approximate the arytenoid cartilages (close rima glottidis)
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): tension and elongation of the vocal folds (has minor adductory effect)
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): thickens the vocal folds and decreases length; also helps to adduct the vocal folds during speech
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): sphincter of the laryngeal inlet
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): abducts and laterally rotates the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments away from the midline and forward and so opening the rima glottidis
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): closes the inlet to the larynx
   * *Speaker phonatory muscles* (*phonatory-muscles*): close the inlet
  * *Mouth speaker* (*TARGET.TEA.SPEAKER*)
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): move vocal cords apart and serve breathing
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): depresses the hyoid and elevates the larynx
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): visceral mucous membrane over soft palate and tonsil
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): depresses the larynx and hyoid bone; carries hyoid bone backward and to the side
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): pulls pharynx and larynx
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): depress hyoid bone
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): elevates larynx, may slightly depress hyoid bone
   * *Speaker respiratory larynx muscles* (*respiratory-muscles*): elevates the thyroid gland
